reviews.review_msg: Don't treat this as a simple GPA booster because Mary really tries hard to teach (which is amazing btw) and it's gets pretty heavy and dense later on. Mary isn't technically the one giving the lectures, but she is marking everything and likes seeing the effort and outwards thinking. The paper, midterm, and final are pretty tough, so don't go easy

I LOVED HER. Take her course! She and the TAs were so helpful with their consistent feedback! As a first year student, this online course was a great way to familiarize myself with canvas, discussion boards, and how university works. I have all good things to say about Dr. Shearman. Definitely would take her course again!

Mary is such a kind and caring prof, and although there were a lot of writings in this class, she marks very fairly. Content was interesting and assignments were pretty straightforward with lots of time to complete it :)

sincerely, I am not sure if her class is this hard because it is online, but she expects too much for a 1st-year course, too many readings, extra discussion, not clear instructions on the midterm. it takes her a while to grade assignments that are not part of the discussion. Maybe in person, she is better but online I would not recommend her.

Literally the best professor I have had at SFU. She cares about her students and understands outside forces that can cause one to struggle to meet deadlines. She also is very passionate about each subject she teaches. I really enjoy learning in her class.

Great prof! Mary really emphasizes participation, and there will be plenty of opportunities to do so. While she may not reply emails directly, she does care for her students and gives very detailed feedback on assignments itself. You can always talk to her after class as well. Would definitely recommend taking a course with her.

AMAZING. If you show up you will learn endlessly. She makes learning very enjoyable. HOWEVER, she knows her stuff so your regular bull won't work with her. Pay the respect that is due to the subject and give effort. If you do this you will be rewarded. You're lucky to have her.

Absolutely love this professor! She is truly connected to her work and explains concepts clearly. She may seem intimidating at first but once you get to know her she is really compassionate. She will go out of her way for her students. Participation and hard work are necessary but I never considered this course grueling. Highly recommend!!

Mary is AMAZING! I can't stress that enough. Within the first two lectures she knew every one of our names! The class was interesting and she always had amazing guest lecturers. I have never taken a GSWS class before and I am so happy this was my first. So helpful and feedback on all our work was so helpful! Great useful class! Amazing teacher!

Mary is super supportive. She won't just grade your paper, she'll give you tips on how to make future essays better. She actually remembers your name, and she cares about helping you pass the class. As long as you say something that will help move along the conversation, she will give you participation marks.
Would take a class again, always there to answer questions and can be quite funny.
Super helpful and always available to help.  Looks like Selma Blair, HOT!

Mary is definitely one of my professors at SFU Burnaby! She is easy to talk to and is very helpful in clarifying course contents. She incorporates lots of short videos, movies, quotes, and autobiography of well-known feminists besides regular notes. She even bumped my marks up from C- to B by going over one of the midterms with her, outstanding!:)

Mary is most definitely the best professor known to man, or should I say womynkind. I attended all of her classes, and contrary to what the above posting states, I did not find her to be monotone, in fact she was the most engaging multi-toned womyn I have ever encountered. She is also ridiculously good looking. I highly recommend taking her class!
Class consisted of 1 midterm, 1 short termpaper (5-8 pages), tutorial participation and a final ( 3 essays). She is a fair prof with clear expectations. Her lectures can be monotone at times.

Lectures content is not even needed. You are given a number of possible questions before the midterm and final. Out of those questions, around 50% appear on the exam. You can skip every class essentially and look up all the answers in the textbook index or wikipedia.
BEST. LECTURER. PERIOD. Cares about the students and is super easy going. I've taken 4 classes with her, none that I found stressful/unfair/uninteresting
easy-going and keeps the material interesting. she's a fair marker and pretty funny actually. recommended :)

Mary was my TA for WS 102 for the Fall 2010 term and she was incredible! She is extremely helpful and takes time out on her free days to answer questions. She explains the material in a way that makes it easier to understand. I have nothing but positive things to say about her. If you have her as a prof for Spring 2011, consider yourself lucky!!
Honestly, Mary is the best professor I have ever had. I wish I could just hire her as my private professor and she can just teach me all of my classes.
Mary is amazing. Her classes are run the way university classes were intended to. I'm actually growing as a student, which doesn't happen often.
